greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of partitions of n into 3 parts without common divisors such that every pair of them has common divisors.
comment: The Heinz numbers of these partitions are the intersection of A014612 (triples), A289509 (relatively prime), and A337694 (pairwise non-coprime). - _Gus Wiseman_, Oct 16 2020
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 31..10000
example: Selected terms and the corresponding triples:
maple: a:= proc(n) option remember; add(add(`if`(igcd(i, j)>1
and igcd(i, j, n-i-j)=1 and igcd(i, n-i-j)>1 and
xref: A023023 does not require pairwise non-coprimality, with strict case A101271.
A202425 and A328672 count these partitions of any length, ranked by A328868.
A307719 is the pairwise coprime instead of non-coprime version.
A337599 does not require relatively primality, with strict case A337605.
A200976 and A328673 count pairwise non-coprime partitions.
A289509 gives Heinz numbers of relatively prime partitions.
A327516 counts pairwise coprime partitions, ranked by A333227.
A337694 gives Heinz numbers of pairwise non-coprime partitions.
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Apr 03 2017
